trial_identification.studytitle: Early Intervention in Acute Renal Failure
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A multi-site randomised phase IV study to evaluate the effectiveness of intravenous erythropoietin in preventing intensive care unit patients with acute kidney injury from developing acute renal failure.

interventions.interventions: Intravenous Erythropoietin in 2 doses at 0 and 24 hours after the detection of a raised urinary acute kidney injury index
interventions.comparator: placebo in 2 doses at 0 and 24 hours after the detection of a raised urinary acute kidney injury index

primaryOutcome.timepoint: 7 days after randomisation. Plasma creatinine will be monitored for up to 12 months after the intervention.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Patients will be followed up for 12 months after enrollment.
Patients will be followed up for 12 months after enrollment.
Patients will be followed up for 12 months after enrollment.
Patients will be followed up for 12 months after enrollment.
Patients will be followed up for 12 months after enrollment.
Patients will be followed up for 12 months after enrollment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Gamma Glutamyl Transpeptidase X Alkaline Phosphatase index of >46.3 u/mmol. 2. Likely survival >72 hours. 3. Consent obtained.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Active cytotoxic chemotherapy in progress2. Pre existing renal disease (serum creatinine >0.345 mmol/L)3. presence of rhabdomyolysis and/or myoglobinuria4. Already enrolled in another interventional study or previously enrolled in this study5. Increase of plasma creatinine of > 43 Âµmol/L over the previous 24 hours.

trial_design.concealment: The pharmacy department will allocate blinded drug/placebo containing syringes according to a stratified randomisation process.
trial_design.sequence: A random number generator has been used and stratified for location. The generator of random number is in-house software developed specifically for randomisation in clinical trials wriiten in visual basic.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: The Health Research Council of New Zealand
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: PO Box 5541, Wellesley Street, Auckland, New Zealand

fundingsource.fundingname: The Health Research Council of New Zealand
fundingsource.fundingaddress: PO Box 5541, Wellesley Street, Auckland, New Zealand

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Patients admitted to a general intensive care unit and high risk post cardiothoracic surgery patients will be screened for renal injury using urinary biomarkers and randomised within 6 hours of admission to two doses of placebo or erythropoietin at 24 hour intervals. Subjects, investigators and treating clinicians will be blinded to treatment throughout the study.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Multi-regional ethics-the Intensive Care Units in Christchurch Hospital
